comment: I took this professor for Drawing I and chose him again for Drawing II. He sets high expectations and gives direct, honest feedback rooted in experience. His critiques have pushed me to grow more than any other class. If you're serious about improving, I highly recommend him.

He constantly talks down to students and doesn't like if you don't do things exactly his way. Lectures for HOURS, about the most useless stuff too.  Doesn't post due dates, horrific pacing, hates tech (strict phone policy will ask you to drop class if you get calls). First project is a 1000 word essay.. for a drawing class. Forgets his own syllabus

My class was pretty small and quiet so had no issue with him being strict, but he does kinda ramble and repeat himself. The feedback he gives is alright but really focused on meeting project criteria rather than about improving your skills, which may be appealing to some but not to me. Overall, he's not the worst but not my favorite.

Prof Callero teaches like you're at RISD, which is good, if you already know how to draw from observation. His projects increase in difficulty real quick, and just to push you to do better he'll never give you a 100. But I really think his challenge helped me improve. That said, if you work hard, you'll prob learn more than those "easy A" classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Me personally, I didn't have any problems with Brett. If you're working hard and trying your best, he'll make sure you pass. He doesn't like when students are on their phones during critique for obvious reasons, and he HATES when students talk while he's giving instructions so be aware. He has a very short temper when it comes to those two things.

I won't be taking again: good feedback, but he expects too much for an intro class. The pacing was horrid at the end of the semester. Sketchbook assignments were tedious and could make/break your grade. Attendance is very crucial. You can't leave class early even if it's a simple day. Take if you want a good challenge and test your passion/skills.

He was a fair grader and provided very insightful feedback, but his standards were incredibly high for a Drawing I intro class. When it came to assignment expectations, could be very unreasonable and condescending. Horrific pacing, sketchbook assignments all due at end of semester (no checkpoint due dates), LOTS of homework (sketchbook + projects).
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Took this class back in 2022. He grades WAY too harshly (even on writing tasks); not all of us were drawing majors. I felt like my personal space was overly invaded when he would come around to look at our work. He WILL tally how many times you comment in critiques. If you're an anxious person like me, this is a nightmare. Pacing was way too fast.

We had lots of time to complete the projects in and outside class. The sketchbooks were the worst because they were time-consuming and I honestly put them on the backburner because of my other classwork. His d2L page is very organized. His lectures were too long. The critiques always gave me so much anxiety. Knows his stuff but too in your face.

Prof Callero gave good feedback and knew how to improve my work every time, but his pacing is awful he gave us little to no time on projects, but we'd spend forever on prep assignments + useless non graded assignments. Also strict no phone policy except for music during work time. Overall do not recommend unless its your only studio class.

Mr. Callero was very understanding & very caring because he could see that I was trying. He allows late work as long as it's not egregiously late. He lets you know what to improve on & encourages you to ask for feedback. I dislike sketchbook assignments due at the end of the semester. He gives class time to work on projects. Try not to skip class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Don't listen to what anyone says, Professor Callero is AWESOME! I had him from Drawing 1 (not listed as an option) and he gave amazing feedback. I feel like I have progressed as an artist with his help. Lots of sketchbook assignments but due at the end of the course. Grades individuals based on their level of ability. I LOVE HIM!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Fair grader, valuable feedback, but class felt like a factory at times. Prep work takes up 2-3 out of 5 classes per project, which is excessive for the quality of art expected. It's doable if this is your only studio art. Also necessary heads up: he posts anonymous pics of students/art on public (unprofessional) social media if you're wary of that.

This class was a little difficult. Be prepared for a lot of redoing your work. Most ideas have to be checked and approved by professor. Was strict with cell phones at times. Very tough grader. Would not take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The pacing of assignments was awful, too short timeframe. His management of critique days required everyone to speak and he tallies them--students who are introverts and don't like to speak impacts their grade. There is no written alternative. He was often late to class himself but took points  off if students were late.

He's a good professor in terms of giving feedback, but the pacing of his assignments is abysmal. He will place a lot of emphasis on prep work for projects but will have a much less smaller period for students to get the actual drawing done in time and also get a good grade. Unless this is your only studio art class, do not get this professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I took this as an elective, and I really enjoyed this class!! Professor Callero had fun projects which allowed us to use different materials like ballpoint pens, colored pencils, scratch board, ect!! He checks with each student one on one and gives helpful and valuable feedback if we need to make improvements for our projects.

There is one thing that makes the class somewhat useful and that is he gives excellent and valuable feedback during projects; other than that. Do not take this class. I would like to preface this by saying this was a drawing 1 class. over the course of the semester, we were plagued by so much work in this class that were graded extremely harshly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Honestly

You have to come to every classbecause Prof. Callero spends every class giving valuable one-on-one WIP critique. He brings the best out of students who are willing to put in the work it takes to actually become an artist, and recognizes effort as well as talent. Projects are exciting, interesting, and relevant to future artistic development.

I don't hate the man but he is definitely not my favorite art professor. You have to attend class even if you're ahead, if you don't need his help, it doesn't matter, you have to be there. He graded writing assignments harshly for an art class. Most of the assignments are fun and the mediums you learn are nice though. An alright professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Callero is one of my favorite professors so far. He is very kind and understanding and gives great advice. He will work with you while you work on projects and help push you in the right direction. His projects are creative and fun! His grading is fair, but you need to work hard if you want an A. Definitely recommend!
